citation.article-title: Yersinia enterocolitica 16S rRNA gene types belong to the same genospecies but form three homology groups.
citation.source: International Journal of Medical Microbiology: IJMM

p.s: Description of Yersinia enterocolitica palearctica subsp. nov.

We propose the names Yersinia enterocolitica subsp. enterocolitica for strains belonging to the 16S rRNA gene type of the Type strain ATCC 9610 and Yersinia enterocolitica subsp. palearctica for strains belonging to the 165 rRNA gene type represented by strain Y11.

The postulated subspecies Yersinia enterocolitica subsp. enterocolitica and Yersinia enterocolitica subsp. palearctica can be described as follows: the phenotypic and biochemical characteristics of the species Yersinia enterocolitica have been demonstrated recently (Aleksic and Bockemiihl, 1990; Bercovier et al., 1980; Brenner et al., 1980).
The subspecies can be distinguished by their distinct 16S rRNA gene type (Ibrahim et al., 1993; Ibrahim, 1995; Neubauer et al., 1999).
The subspecies Y. enterocolitica subsp. enterocolitica is characterized by the sequence 5'-AAGGCCAATAACTTAATACGTTGTTGGATT-3' (451-480 nt of M59292) with the reference strain ATCC 9610.
The subspecies Y. enterocolitica subsp. palearctica is characterized by the sequence 5'-AAGGCATAAAGGTTAATAACCTTTGTGATT-3' (451-480 nt ofU63135) with the reference strain Y11 DSMZ13030.
Both strains have been compared in detail (Neubauer et al., 1999).
